author: Stuart Hess at SuperSport Park
title: India capitulate to hand SA emphatic innings win in Boxing Day Test
text:
Cricket India capitulate to hand SA emphatic innings win in Boxing Day Test 28 December 2023 - 17:50 By Stuart Hess at SuperSport Park Proteas batter Dean Elgar celebrate with Nandre Burger during day three of the first Test between South Africa and India at SuperSport Park in Centurion.
Image: Christiaan Kotze/BackpagePix
The end, when it came, came quickly.
India folded like the proverbial deck of cards.
The "final frontier", as many in India have described South Africa, remains unconquered.
To the list of great captains who have led India in Test series‚Äô in this country and lost or drew, can now be added the name of Rohit Sharma - who personally had dreadful match scoring five and naught.
This first Test eventually turned into a rout, with the Proteas registering an innings and 32-run victory, a first win by an innings since beating England at Lord‚Äôs in 2022 and the first against India, since Jacques Kallis‚Äôs maiden double ton inspired an innings and 25-run win in 2010.
It was an almost embarrassing capitulation.
üáøüá¶THE PROTEAS LEAD THE FREEDOM SERIES
A mammoth all-round effort from the Proteas to take a 1-0 lead in the #Betway Test Seriesüáøüá¶üáÆüá≥
What a victory by the boys üí™üòÖ
The Final Frontier Continues üòé #WozaNawe #BePartOfIt #SAvIND pic.twitter.com/MFWVAgphxS
‚Äî Proteas Men (@ProteasMenCSA) December 28, 2023 India were 52/2 in the 19th over, still trailing SA by 111 runs, but still in a position from which they could have expected to set South Africa a tricky fourth innings run chase.
The pitch was still providing plenty of assistance to the seamers, as Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj had shown with a 70-over old ball in the morning.
The Proteas through Dean Elgar and Marco Jansen, who shared a 111-run sixth wicket partnership had also illustrated how with guts and calculated batting, locating the boundary remained possible.
They had stretched the Proteas lead to 163, with Jansen‚Äôs career-best 84 not out, featuring plenty of excellent drives through the covers.
Having dismissed Rohit Sharma - with a peach from Rabada - and Yashasvi Jaiswal before tea, South Africa started to sniff victory.
But with Shreyas Iyer and Virat Kohli starting to put together a solid partnership India were looking for a foothold.
Then Marco Jansen knocked over Iyer with a yorker and the pace of the afternoon‚Äôs play suddenly accelerated.
‚ÄòThings went my way': Proteas batter Dean Elgar after finally getting his century in Centurion Proteas opening batter Dean Elgar has some unfinished business in this Boxing Day Test. Sport 1 week ago Nandre Burger returned to pick up two wickets off consecutive deliveries, and from 52/2 in the 19th over, India were shot out for 131 in the 35th, a collapse of 79/8 in 16 overs.
Only Kohli showed the necessary skill to get on top of the SA bowlers, making 76 off 82 balls, but his composure was also absent at times, as shown in his role in the crazy run out of Jasprit Bumrah.
There will be plenty of questions for the Indians to answer.
This series, diabolically only lasting two matches, is one they now cannot win.
SA remains the only country in which India has yet to win a Test series.
For South Africa this win will provide a much needed boost in morale.
For Dean Elgar it was a personal triumph.
‚ÄòIt was just my day‚Äô: Rabada on his five-star Boxing Day Test day one display Proteas front-line fast bowler Kagiso ‚ÄòKG‚Äô Rabada was almost lost for words when asked to describe his masterful, clinical and almost flawless ... Sport 1 week ago Having announced his retirement from Test cricket - a decision partly down to the lack of Test match play for the Proteas in the next few years - he produced one of his best performances in making 185 and anchored the SA first innings in which they scored 408 on a difficult pitch, with overhead conditions also favouring the bowlers.
He ended up as captain too with Temba Bavuma not able to take the field because of a hamstring strain he picked up while fielding on the first day.
The team‚Äôs management, following numerous inquiries over the last few days, finally provided an update on Thursday afternoon, that stated Bavuma was still undergoing ‚Äúcontinuous medical assessments.‚Äù
Although there‚Äôd been speculation about him possibly batting, that was deemed too risky.
Fortunately India‚Äôs fragility and the brilliance of SA‚Äôs bowlers meant a fourth innings run chase was eliminated.
Rabada finished with 2/32, while debutant Nandre Burger claimed 4/33 and Jansen, despite some struggles with control, took 3/36.
There will be concerns about the fielding, with South Africa dropping five catches in the matches, three in India‚Äôs second innings.
But that is a problem that can be addressed from a position of triumph.

author: HANNAH BROWN, CHANDA VENO
title: 'We don't want them to freeze to death': Frankfort gearing up to help those who need to get out of upcoming inclement weather | News | state-journal.com
text:
With frigid temperatures moving into the area, local organizations are expanding their services to help those who need to get out of inclement weather. On Tuesday, the expected high is 18 degrees, according to the National Weather Service.
"I have been to some of the encampments myself, and have seen the effects firsthand," explained City Manager Jason Monroe. "Homelessness is a major concern in our city, as it is in many, but to help with this issue we need to find its root cause. The lack of affordable housing and housing, in general, is one of the factors contributing to this issue that we need to tackle."

author: financialcontent.com
title: Intense Supernatural Thriller ‚ÄúTorment: Descension‚Äù by Daniel Foster Unleashes a Gripping Tale of Faith, Morality, and the Unseen Forces | FinancialContent Business Page
text:
Daniel Foster, an acclaimed author unveils a gripping supernatural thriller in his latest release, "Torment: Descension." David and Grace, blissful new parents, face a terrifying ordeal when their infant son falls gravely ill. Foster's narrative explores the profound question: How far would one go to save their family?
"Torment: Descension" thrusts readers into a classic battle of good versus evil, following David's harrowing journey as he confronts moral dilemmas to rescue his child. The story probes the resilience of faith amidst adversity, forcing David to navigate a world where every choice carries profound consequences.
Foster's storytelling skills and suspenseful plot, challenge readers with universal themes of morality and spirituality. Should David's faith be strongest in times of need? Or can a momentary lapse lead to the worst decision of his life? Foster poses questions that resonate with the masses, creating a thought-provoking narrative that makes its own special place in the readers‚Äô minds.
"Torment: Descension" is now available on Amazon.
Link: https://a.co/d/ft2KxSH
For further information, review copies or interviews, contact at: start2finishcomics@gmail.com
 Daniel Foster
Contact Person: Daniel Foster
Email: Send Email
Country: United States
Website: https://a.co/d/ft2KxSH

author: Ruth C√°rcamo
title: Fuertes vientos causan diversos da√±os en zonas de Chile: emiten alarma meteorol√≥gica para las regiones de O‚ÄôHiggins y Metropolitana | ADN Radio
text: FOTOS Y VIDEOS. Fuertes vientos causan diversos da√±os en zonas de Chile: emiten alarma meteorol√≥gica para las regiones de O‚ÄôHiggins y Metropolitana Agosto inici√≥ con un fen√≥meno clim√°tico que ha dejado varios destrozos durante su paso por la zona centro-sur del territorio nacional. Incluso, ya hay varios heridos, tres fallecidos y el Aeropuerto de Santiago debi√≥ cancelar aterrizajes. Un [intenso sistema frontal](https://www.adnradio.cl/2024/08/02/autos-quemados-caida-de-antena-telefonica-y-arboles-los-efectos-y-destrozos-que-ha-dejado-el-sistema-frontal-en-la-region-metropolitana/) est√° viviendo nuestro octavo mes del a√±o, con lluvias que se prolongar√°n hasta este s√°bado. A esto se sumaron fuertes r√°fagas de viento que superaron los 100 km/h en algunas zonas del pa√≠s. Incluso, la Direcci√≥n Meteorol√≥gica de Chile emiti√≥ una alarma meteorol√≥gica para la regi√≥n Metropolitana y de O‚ÄôHiggins por ‚Äúviento intenso‚Äù, que estar√° vigente hasta esta ma√±ana. El viento no paso desapercibido, y r√°pidamente se compartieron en redes sociales diversos registros de las fuertes r√°fagas que afectaron a varias comunas, donde hubo desprendimientos de techos y ca√≠das de √°rboles. Asimismo, en las √∫ltimas horas se dieron a conocer [nuevos destrozos en varias zonas de la regi√≥n Metropolitana](https://www.adnradio.cl/2024/08/02/autos-quemados-caida-de-antena-telefonica-y-arboles-los-efectos-y-destrozos-que-ha-dejado-el-sistema-frontal-en-la-region-metropolitana/), que han dejado a varios heridos y una persona fallecida, luego de que una [palmera cayera arriba del auto en el que iba](https://www.adnradio.cl/2024/08/02/sistema-frontal-una-persona-muere-por-caida-de-palmera-en-estacion-central-tras-fuertes-rafagas-de-viento-en-la-region-metropolitana/). [Autos quemados, ca√≠da de antena telef√≥nica y √°rboles: los efectos y destrozos que ha dejado el sistema frontal en la regi√≥n Metropolitana](https://www.adnradio.cl/2024/08/02/autos-quemados-caida-de-antena-telefonica-y-arboles-los-efectos-y-destrozos-que-ha-dejado-el-sistema-frontal-en-la-region-metropolitana/) Revisa a continuaci√≥n las im√°genes que muestran los da√±os que han dejado las fuertes r√°fagas de viento: [Podcasts recomendados](https://www.adnradio.cl/podcast/) [Ver todos](https://www.adnradio.cl/podcast/)

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Charles Woodson has shocking take on what position Colorado's Travis Hunter is better at
text:
By Kevin Borba ,
1 hour ago
When it comes to Colorado two-way star Travis Hunter, he is quite literally the most versatile player in college football.
His Paul Hornung Award trophy that he received for dominating this past season on both offense and defense proves just that. While he was viewed as a corner by just about every college coach that recruited him, Deion Sanders always viewed him as a two-way star and is using him as such as he looks to rebuild the Colorado program.
However, while one former two-way star like Sanders thinks Hunter is great at both and should continue to play both, fellow former two-way star Charles Woodson who excelled at Michigan in every way imaginable thinks Hunter should stick to receiver. Not because he isn't a good corner, but because he is just so dominant as a receiver. Woodson also touched on the fact that Hunter is a true two-way player, while he himself had a smaller role than most realize.
"He truly plays both ways," Woodson explained to Will Compton and Taylor Lewan on Bussin' With The Boys. "Like a 130 plus plays a game...like I tell people like I dibbled and dabbled on offense and I didn't play a whole lot of offense. It just seems like it."
Woodson finished his college career with 21 catches for 370 yards and three scores, while also rushing two as well. When asked where Hunter's best at, Woods went with his biggest enemy in the NFL, receiver.
"I think receiver, I think he's nasty at receiver. I mean he's a good corner don't get me wrong, but I see his offensive skills man...I think his offensive skills dominate over his defensive skills."
Related: Deion Sanders says Travis Hunter will cause a major problem when he gets to the NFL
This past season, Hunter racked up 57 catches for 721 yards and five scores on offense, while totaling 31 tackles, five pass breakups, and nabbing three picks. Based on recent comments from his head coach that urged NFL teams to let Hunter play both ways at the next level, it is safe to assume he will continue to be featured heavily on both sides.
Expand All Read in NewsBreak
